quiz.question:
Who Developed Java? James Gosling
Charles Babbage

What was the original name of Java? Oak
Groovey

What is the full form of JDK? Java Developing Kit
Java Development Kit

What is an class in Java? It is an representation of a set of objects
Datatype

What is Abstraction in Java? Representation for the specific behaviour of an object
Act of Representing essential features only without any background details

What is Encapsulation in Java? Wrapping up of data into a single unit
Use to declaire an Object

What is an Method? The number and types of Arguments
A sequence of statements that carry out specific task(s)

What is the other name of Method? Array
Function

What is an Object? Identifiable entity with some Characteristics and Behaviour
Blue print of an Program

What is an Object Factory? A producer of method
A producer of class

How are methods related to an object? The behaviour of an object is represented through associated methods
An object is created through an method

How do you implement Object into software? It wraps up the data and associated methods into a single unit called class
Characteristics / attributes through data members

How do you implement Encapsulation into software? The data and associated method is wrapped up into a single unit called instance of a class
The data and associated method is wrapped up into a single unit called datatype

What is an Byte Code? Java interpreter
It is a machine instruction for JVM

What is an Source Code? The code written by a programmer
It is a machine instruction for your Operating System

What is the full form of JVM? Java Visual Machine
Java Virtual Machine

What is JVM? An Feature of BlueJ
Java Interpreter

What is Native Executable Code? Resultant Code of Ordinary Compilation
Machine instruction to JVM

What are Java APIs? Libraries of compiled code which can be used in Java Program
Java Platform to program Applications

What is the full form of WORA? Write Once Run Anywhere
Write Once Read After

What is WORA in Java? It means Java Programs written once can be read anytime
It means Java Programs written once can be run on any platform without making any change to the code

What is Platform Independence of Java? It means Java can be run only in its own platform
It means Java Programs can be use in any platform without making any changes to it

What are the names of two types of Java Programs? Stand Alone Applications and Internet Appleats
JAR and JAD

Which shortcut key(s) is use to save your Program in BlueJ? CTRL+SHIFT+I
CTRL+S

Which shortcut key(s) is use to generate Documentation of an Program/Project in BlueJ? CTRL+J
CTRL+W

What is an JAR File? Mobile file
File which contains all the files of your project

Which shortcut key is use to Compile the Code within the BlueJ Editor? CTRL+K
CTRL+C

How would you describe Java language? Programming Language
Programming Language and Platform

Which statement is use to print any error in Java? System.err.println(\"...\")
System.out.printline(\"...\")

Which of these is use to print your text in a new line? System.println(\"...\")
System.out.println(\"...\")

What is an Token? Reserved word
An Keyword

What are Keywords? Reserved words
Unreserved words

Keywords are also known as? Reserved words
Editable words

Which of these is an illegal Java Identifier? _CLASS
default

What are Literals? Data items that are fixed data values
Changable data values

In Java Hexadecimal Literals are written as? OX/(number)
OX(number)

Which of these represents new line? \\n
\\t\n

Which of these is an Real Literal in Java? Character Literal
Floating Literal

Which of these represents null(0)? \\0
\\null
